node.title: What's behind the push for a fourth stimulus check
node.description: IRS has distributed almost 170 million payments. But hardship remains widespread as the Delta variant spreads.

node.title: Nick Cannon's 5-month-old son dies of brain cancer
node.description: Cannon said his son was "always smiling" and that he had "the most beautiful spirit."

node.title: Democratic senators want student loan interest waived
node.description: The group of lawmakers also wants the Biden administration to give borrowers who defaulted a "fresh start" with automatic rehabilitation of their loans.

node.title: CEOs, scientists on whether current vaccines can fight Omicron
node.description: Moderna president said current COVID-19 vaccines probably aren't effective against the new variant.

node.title: Epstein accuser wants Maxwell "behind bars for the rest of her life"
node.description: Sarah Ransome said she was recruited into Jeffrey Epstein's alleged sex trafficking ring in 2006 when she was just 22.

node.title: Man admits to another killing just before his execution
node.description: David Neal Cox said he killed his sister-in-law in 2007 and provided detailed instructions on where investigators could find her remains, a prosecutor said.

node.title: Experts say economy needs some pandemic retirees to "unretire"
node.description: Americans are already working more days, longer hours and later in life than people in other industrial countries, but the average age of retirement ticked down during the pandemic.

node.title: The head of Instagram will take the hot seat in a congressional hearing.
node.description: Lawmakers are expected to grill Mr. Mosseri over leaked internal research that said the app had a toxic effect on some teenagers.

node.title: Congress gets a crash course on cryptocurrency.
node.description: The chief executives of six cryptocurrency companies will face questions from the House Financial Services Committee about risk and regulation.

node.title: China Media Pundit Says He Hopes Joe Biden Lives to See LA Olympics Boycott
node.description: Beijing says it isn't bothered by the U.S. diplomatic boycott of the Winter Games, but diplomats and state media personalities are lining up to criticize it on social media.

node.title: Climber allowed to keep $169,000 of gems he found on Mont Blanc
node.description: The precious stones had remained hidden in a metal box that was on board an Indian plane that crashed some 50 years earlier.

node.title: More than 50 cities competing for remote workers
node.description: Cities like Tulsa, Oklahoma, are competing for workers who are up for grabs now that they can work from anywhere.

node.title: Group Backed by Top Companies Moves to Combat A.I. Bias in Hiring
node.description: The organization has created a format for evaluating the technology, which is often used to screen job candidates.

node.title: Hydrocephalus Symptoms Explained As Nick Cannon's 5-Month-Old Son Zen Dies of Brain Cancer
node.description: The TV presenter announced the death of his youngest son on his talk show, and said he first noticed something was wrong because of his "interesting breathing."

node.title: Omicron has "robust ability" to evade vaccines, but there is good news
node.description: Experts in South Africa have raced to test vaccines against the new variant.

node.title: Who Is Bipin Rawat? Helicopter Crashes With India's Top General Aboard
node.description: Defense chief General Bipin Rawat was aboard an Mi-17V5 helicopter that crashed near the town of Coonoor in southern India.

node.title: Wendy's Drive-Thru Customer Fires Gun Over Order 'Taking Too Long': Police
node.description: Police told journalists that Tia Taylor reportedly fired the shots because she "was upset with her order."

node.title: Hawaii Weather for December: What Is the Forecast for the Rest of the Month?
node.description: The threat of heavy rain and thunderstorms remains in some parts of Hawaii through Wednesday morning, the National Weather Service said.

node.title: Café Sign Looking for Staff Who 'Doesn't Cry, Is Never Late, Has No Excuses' Blasted Online
node.description: "Whoever wrote that sign does not value other human beings," said one commenter.

node.title: 34 killed in volcano eruption, rain, lava hamper search for 22 missing
node.description: There had been no survivors found under the debris since Saturday, and the death toll is expected to rise as more bodies are recovered.

node.title: Ukraine, Explained
node.description: And why people are fearing war there.

node.title: Human Skull Discovery Leads to Makeshift Guillotine in California Home
node.description: Police say Robert Enger impaled himself on a makeshift guillotine in his home in Santa Rosa, California.

node.title: China's ambitions in the world and what they mean to U.S.
node.description: Produced in partnership with the Michael V. Hayden Center, in this episode, host Michael Morell discusses the implications of China's geopolitical ambitions for the U.S.

node.title: Omicron Not Wholly Evading Pfizer COVID Vaccine in Study Gives Scientists Cause for Hope
node.description: Some researchers expressed cautious optimism about a small study showing that the variant does not completely escape vaccine immunity.

node.title: Joe Biden, NATO Warned to Concede Nothing, Act Against Russia Before it Invades Ukraine
node.description: Two former ambassadors in Ukraine and the U.S. urged President Joe Biden and NATO not to reward Russia's President Vladimir Putin for his attempted blackmail.

node.title: Which Countries Are Boycotting China's Winter Olympics? Full List
node.description: With only weeks remaining until Beijing 2022 opens next February 4, the United States is leading a wave of diplomatic boycotts over China's human rights abuses.

node.title: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Mocks Lauren Boebert Over Christmas Gun Photo
node.description: "Lol," wrote AOC, "all the years Republicans spent on cultural hysteria of society 'erasing Christmas and it's meaning.'"

node.title: The Fashion Institute of Technology Will Open a Social Justice Center
node.description: With nearly $4 million in funding, the school wants to build a pipeline of diverse fashion talent from middle school to the C-suite.

node.title: The Year on the Red Carpet
node.description: All that pent-up dressing up finally found an outlet. If it wasn’t a carpet per se, it was a public moment.

node.title: Newly Published, From Roman Art to the Sri Lankan Civil War
node.description: A selection of books published this week.
